intro: Aspidogyne rotundifolia, commonly known as the round-leaf aspidogyne, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, opposite leaves that are typically rounded or elliptic in shape. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. The plant is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories or along stream banks.
